intro: Uragoga cochoeirensis, commonly known as the Cochoeirensis uragoga, is a rare flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale pink. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments within the understory of tropical forests. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and is the subject of conservation efforts.
